channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 过于忠诚会损害工人的利益，因为他们有可能被赋予额外的工作，却得不到额外的回报。毕竟，狗是以忠诚著称的，而不是以头脑著称👇。
item.description:
Too much loyalty can harm workers who risk being given extra work for little extra reward. After all, dogs are known for their loyalty but not for their brains https://t.co/q2kE1wM4IG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 永无止境的古拉格：俄罗斯政治犯的一天
item.description:

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.description:
The booze industry reveals a lot about Kenya https://t.co/J8EtYJkprO

item.title: 新药可能会终结世界肥胖症的流行。必须仔细研究其长期影响--但兴奋是有道理的 👇
item.description:
New drugs could spell an end to the world’s obesity epidemic. The long-term effects must be carefully studied—but the excitement is justified https://t.co/bBNiij9Bsc👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 近几十年来，全球价值观发生了重大转变，而且是非同寻常的转变。探索我们的互动平台，了解它是什么👇。
item.description:
In recent decades there has been a substantial shift in global values—and an extraordinary one. Explore our interactive to discover what it is https://t.co/Bclx2qmeJ7 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 中国能否利用生成式人工智能的力量？在我们的 "鼓楼 "播客中，@aliceysu 和 @donweinland 讨论了 Ernie Bot，它对 ChatGPT 🎧 的回答。
item.description:
Will China be able to harness the power of generative AI? On our “Drum Tower” podcast @aliceysu and @donweinland discuss Ernie Bot, its answer to ChatGPT https://t.co/NxIauW1XGs 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 姜黄正在杀人。它在皮肤上染上的黄色可能具有欺骗性和致命性。一个国家有一种开明的处理方法 👇
item.description:
Turmeric is killing people. Its skin­-staining yel­lowness can be deceptive and deadly. One country has an enlightened way of dealing with it https://t.co/m98goR05MK 👇

item.title: 从对巨型项目的探讨，到关于金融领域最重要、最被忽视的问题之一的引人入胜的书籍，我们精选了九本书，加入您的阅读清单👇。
item.description:
From an exploration of megaprojects to a compelling book on one of the most important and neglected questions in finance, we’ve picked out nine titles to add to your reading list https://t.co/Un6MsUjQ8q 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 是什么驱使人们离开中国城市，前往山区？一本新书探讨了为什么越来越多的城市人参与到一种被称为 "返古 "的潮流中👇。
item.description:
What is driving people out of Chinese cities to the mountains? A new book examines why growing numbers of urbanites are partaking of a trend known as fugu (a return to old ways) https://t.co/aLb5RPIyss 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

The world’s biggest maker of spectacles wants to be a tech firm https://t.co/nZ8h3T7G9i

item.title: 印度最高法院做出的具有里程碑意义的裁决可以说使印度变得更加进步。但是，任何指望最高法院能够有力遏制纳伦德拉-莫迪独裁倾向的人都可能会失望。
item.description:
Landmark rulings from India’s Supreme Court have arguably made the country more progressive. But anyone counting on the court to emerge as a strong check on Narendra Modi’s authoritarian drift is liable to be disappointed https://t.co/U0adOys7ok

Illustration: Lan Truong pic.twitter.com/HygdLuajLo

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰的命运如何衰退
item.description:
How Ukraine’s fortunes have ebbed https://t.co/yzSn9JhWlM

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 2017 年，中国发表的科学论文数量超过任何其他国家。从那时起，它就一直保持着第一的位置。但是，虽然有些研究是前沿性的，但也有许多是可疑的👇。
item.description:
China published more scientific papers than any other country in 2017. It has kept the top spot ever since. But while some of the research has been cutting-edge, much has been dodgy https://t.co/W7w0NYrDxa 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 习近平将中国共产党的触角伸向中国的日常生活，将解决现实问题作为加强社会控制的一种方式。但改变人心很难👇。
item.description:
Xi Jinping has increased the Communist Party’s reach into everyday lives in China, tackling real-life problems as a way to strengthen social controls. But changing hearts and minds is hard https://t.co/oh6sN1P8lp 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 时尚品牌纷纷押注零售地产。2021 年收购蒂芙尼的路威酩轩集团（LVMH）已在伦敦邦德街和巴黎香榭丽舍大街进行了投资。纽约第五大道上也出现了大量交易👇。
item.description:
Fashion houses are betting big on retail property. LVMH, which bought Tiffany’s in 2021, has invested in Bond Street in London and the Champs-Elysées in Paris. There has been a flurry of deals on New York’s Fifth Avenue too https://t.co/pfXLhITE40 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 在日本，随着结婚率的下降和越来越多的女性加入劳动力大军，性别关系正在发生转变。但是，男性养家糊口的观念仍然根深蒂固。这种文化能否改变？ 👇
item.description:
In Japan, gender relations are shifting as marriage rates decline and more women enter the workforce. But the idea that men are breadwinners remains deeply entrenched. Can the culture change? https://t.co/1wiPwpUZcD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 没有美国的帮助，欧洲能否自保？我们的 "制衡 "播客进行了调查。敬请收听 @JohnPrideaux、@chowardchoward 和 @imkahloon 🎧 。
item.description:
Would Europe be able to defend itself without America’s help? Our “Checks and Balance” podcast investigates. With @JohnPrideaux, @chowardchoward and @imkahloon https://t.co/xeNuTfWHin 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼是每个俄罗斯人，是成千上万声音通常被扼杀的人之一。我们缅怀这位反抗弗拉基米尔-普京--揭露其堕落的反对派领袖的一生👇。
item.description:
Alexei Navalny was Everyman, every Russian; one of the hundreds of thousands whose voices were usually stifled.

We remember the life of the opposition leader who defied Vladimir Putin—and showed up his depravity https://t.co/3P6Leo9CbE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 26, 2024

item.title: 在整个 2010 年代，美国独角兽公司（估值超过 10 亿美元的私营公司）的数量激增。2021 年，独角兽公司的数量达到了 344 家。现在是悼念独角兽的时候了吗？ 🦄
item.description:
Throughout the 2010s the number of unicorns—private companies with valuations above $1bn—soared in America. Fully 344 of them were minted in 2021. Last year’s ﬁgure was 45.

Is it time to mourn the unicorn—or will they not be all that missed? https://t.co/sRjwOGg7Vy 🦄

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 25, 2024

item.title: 中国意识形态和宣传部门负责人的一本旧书是冷战结束前的时间胶囊--为美国人提供了借鉴 ⬇️
item.description:
An old book by China’s chief of ideology and propaganda is a time capsule from back before the cold war ended—and offers lessons for Americans https://t.co/6hAUgPJJFb ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 25, 2024

item.title: 长期以来，教育一直是数字化的落后者。人工智能能否最终改变这一现状？请听 "Money Talks"：
item.description:
Education has long been a digital laggard. Could AI finally change that? Listen to “Money Talks”: https://t.co/CJWGLTGNv9 pic.twitter.com/QxlSSxM5ni

item.title: 政府影响了大量的文学作品。其中有些还很不错。以下是六本你不知道的宣传书籍👇。
item.description:

item.description:
The stockmarket boom is unlikely to last. Although AI is propelling valuations, there are deeper forces at work https://t.co/iLBmtBHNYZ 👇
